intro: Calochlamys, commonly known as the goldenbush, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Fabaceae. It is characterized by its compact shrub form and striking yellow or orange flowers that bloom in spring. The leaves are typically trifoliate, consisting of three small, oval-shaped leaflets. Calochlamys species are native to southern Africa and are often found in rocky or sandy soils. These plants are valued for their ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in dry, sunny conditions.
